section.title: What is MiTeam Meetings?
section.p: MiTeam Meetings is a CloudLink- based multi-party video solution designed for users who want to improve work efficiency and enhance workplace communication with seamless transitions between voice, video, and chat capabilities for a complete collaboration experience. It enables users to access features such as:
Collaborate: Perform audio, video, and web sharing
Chat: Hold chat sessions and receive chat notifications within a meeting
File Sharing: Store and share files

section.title: Can MiTeam Meeting be integrated with my other Mitel products?
section.p: At present, MiTeam Meetings is fully integrated only with MiCollab. It is available for, and does have some integration with MiCloud Connect. It is also available as a stand alone product to all Mitel Customers.

p.b: Can I continue to use MiCollab Audio, Web & Video Conferencing (AWV)?

li.p: If you have both AWV and MiTeam Meetings installed in your system, by default MiTeam Meetings will be the video tool that is launched when you click a meeting invite. However, you can still use AWV manually.

ul.li: Custom avatars are not currently supported in MiTeam Meetings for MiCloud Connect users
Chat sessions from MiTeam Meetings also show up in the Teamwork Client.
To join MiTeam Meetings, MiCloud Connect users receive an email invitation and use their Connect client credentials to log in.
MiCloud Connect users can contact Support as described in Contact Us.
Custom avatars are not currently supported in the Stand-Alone MiTeam Meetings application

section.title: What's the capacity for MiTeam Meetings?
section.p: For details, see .

section.title: How does the app notify users that they have been invited to a meeting?

ul.li: If a user has previously used the MiTeam Meetings application, there will be an Operating System notification (such as a system tray notification in Windows), even if the app is closed.

A registered user who has CloudLink chat enabled in MiCollab will get a notification (Join now button) in the chat conversation to join a meeting. The users must have their MiCollab open to see the invite notifications.
A guest user will receive an email invitation.

section.title: Can I provide toll-free meeting attendance when I invite customers to a meeting?
section.p: Toll-free attendance for MiTeam Meetings is not currently supported.

section.title: I would like to use MiTeam Meetings for presentations and brainstorming sessions. Can I use video conferencing in multiple modes?
section.p: Yes, MiTeam Meetings has two video modes – video tiles and active speaker (experimental feature). You can also enable screenshare at any time.

section.title: What do green borders around video tiles represent?
section.p: The green border indicates the active speaker.

section.title: How do I report a bug or submit feedback during a meeting?
section.p: During an ongoing meeting, click from the control panel. The Settings panel is displayed. Click the Others tab and then click Report Problem. Explain about the issue you are facing and click Send to submit the issue.Click Share an idea to share a new feature idea.

section.title: Where can I find dial-in information to call in by phone?
section.p: In the Settings page, switch the audio slider to Dial In to view a list of dial-in phone numbers. You can also get this information when you click from within the Chat Window panel.

section.title: Is MiTeam Meetings integrated with Outlook Calendar so that I can schedule a meeting directly from Outlook?
section.p: Outlook Calendar integration is not currently supported.

section.title: Do you support huddle rooms?
section.p: This feature is not supported in this release. In this release, support is limited to USB cameras and audio equipment.

section.title: Can I join a meeting from an existing room system?
section.p: This feature is not supported in this release.

section.title: Can MiTeam Meetings be recorded?
section.p: MiTeam Meetings do not have recording capabilities.

section.title: How do I enable the camera and the microphone for MiTeam Meetings desktop application in Windows and Mac OS?
section.p: The option to enable the camera and the microphone for MiTeam Meetings desktop application is specific to the operating system in which you have deployed the application. Click the following links for instructions on enabling the camera and the microphone specific to your operating system.

ol.li: Choose Start > Control Panel > Hardware and Sound > Sound > Manage audio devices. A panel opens.

Click:
The Recording tab for enabling a microphone.
The Playback tab for enabling a speaker.
Right-click the device in the list you want to use with MiTeam Meetings and then click Properties.
Click the Advanced tab. Make sure that the two check boxes under Exclusive Mode are selected.
Click OK to save the changes.

body.p: If you still face issues with your camera or microphone, or if the message Camera is in use by another application or operating system is configured to deny camera access displays when you log in to a meeting from your MiTeam Meetings Desktop application, do either of the following:

ul.li: close all other applications that are using your camera or microphone

section.title: How do I enable the camera and the microphone for MiTeam Meetings web application in a browser?
section.p: The option to enable the camera and the microphone for MiTeam Meetings web application is specific to the browser in which you have deployed the application. A common prerequisite is that you must have already enabled permission for the browser to have access to the camera and microphone.This is done from the Control panel/Settings menu of your operating system. For more information about how to do this, see the links pertaining to your operating system in the FAQ “How do I enable the camera and the microphone for MiTeam Meetings desktop application in Windows and Mac OS?”.

After the prerequisite is set, you are prompted to choose device permissions for camera and microphone in the Welcome page. Click Allow to enable access for the camera and microphone or click Don’t Allow to deny access. To change these permissions subsequently, follow instructions pertinent to your browser.

section.title: Anti-malware programs blocking access to camera, speaker, or microphone.
section.p: Instances of some anti-malware programs blocking access to the camera on the PC have been reported. We have confirmed one such case with the anti-malware program 'HitmanPro'. If you face issues with accessing the camera or other PC resources, check whether any of these programs are running. You must either stop such programs, or if you have such programs running, you must whitelist our installed client or the browser.

section.title: How do I install MiTeam Meetings application in the Windows 10 operating system?
section.p: You will not be able to install the MiTeam Meetings application in Windows 10 if the Installing Apps settings is set to Allow apps from the Store only. To change this setting, do the following:

ol.li: Press Windows key + I to open the Settings app.
Click Apps & features from the left pane.
Under Installing apps, expand the drop-down menu and choose Turn off app recommendations.

section.p: You can now run the setup file of the MiTeam Meetings application to install it.

section.title: How can I choose the speaker for MiTeam Meetings web application in Firefox and Safari browsers?
section.p: With Firefox and Safari browsers, the MiTeam Meetings web application uses the speaker currently selected as the default speaker in the operating system to play the meeting audio. Neither the MiTeam Meetings web application nor the browsers provide the option of switching to a different speaker to play the audio during an ongoing meeting. Hence, in Firefox and Safari browsers, to choose a specific speaker for MiTeam Meetings, the user must choose that speaker as the default in the default settings of the native operating system before joining the meeting. To choose the default speaker, follow instructions pertinent to your operating system.

ol.li: In the search box on the taskbar, type Control Panel, then select it from the results.
Select Hardware and Sound from the Control Panel, and then select Sound.
In the Playback tab, right-click the listing for your audio device, select Set as Default Device, and then select OK.

section.title: How can I restore meeting audio after reloading the MiTeam Meetings web application during a meeting in Firefox browser?
section.p: After joining a meeting via the MiTeam Meetings web application using Firefox, if you reload the Meetings application during the meeting, you may lose the meeting audio and the Autoplay icon () will be displayed in the address bar. This is because, by default, Firefox blocks all voice media from playing. To restore the meeting audio you must modify the Autoplay settings in Firefox. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/block-autoplay for more information.

title.b: How can I enable screen sharing in macOS?

section.p: On macOS devices, when you proceed to share your screen for the first time during a meeting, a system prompt appears: “ MiTeam Meetings” would like to record this computer’s screen. This is because of the increased security and permissions in macOS. Hence, you must allow MiTeam Meetings access to Screen Recording to share your screen during a meeting on macOS devices.
To do this,

ol.li: In the prompt dialog box, choose Open System Preferences and enable Screen Recording for MiTeam Meetings by using the instructions in Control access to screen recording on Mac. After you save the changes, a window opens asking you to quit MiTeam Meetings application.
Click Quit Now and then reopen MiTeam Meetings. You can now join the meeting and share your screen.

section.note: If you choose to Deny MiTeam Meetings access during the initial prompt or if the Screen Recording access becomes disabled, you must go into your OS System Preferences to allow access by using the instructions in Control access to screen recording on Mac and then repeat step 2.

title.b: What happens to my problem report?

section.p: To help troubleshoot your report quickly, please provide as much information as possible. Specific details are needed to properly investigate an issue. Date, time, device information, and logs are collected as part of your problem report. After you report an issue, the onsite Support Contact for your account will receive an email notifying that you have reported a problem. The onsite Support Contact will investigate the issue. They might reach out to you for additional information. If your Support Contact needs assistance to resolve your issue, they will escalate through their standard support procedures. Please follow up directly with your onsite Support Contact for updates about your report.
